projects.information: A project is defined as a sequence of tasks that must be completed to attain a certain outcome. According to the Project Management Institute (PMI), the term Project refers to ” to any temporary endeavor with a definite beginning and end”. Depending on its complexity, it can be managed by a single person or hundreds.

general.introduction: Need some mock data to test your app? Mocker lets you generate up to 1,000 rows of realistic test data in CSV, JSON, SQL, and Excel formats.

table_detail.instruction: Please click ADD ANOTHER FIELD button to add an field to this table.

schemas.information: A database schema is (generally) broadly divided into two categories: physical database schema that defines how the data-like files are actually stored; and logical database schema, which describes all the logical constraints -- including integrity, tables and views -- applied on the stored data.
schemas.name: name

groups.information: A Group is basically an assemblage of people. It can be understood as a collection of individuals (two or more), who come together and interact with each other, so as to achieve the objectives of the organization.
groups.name: name

grid.values_empty: The values are empty, you can create a new one by using the create button.
grid.values_no_match: The values are not match with the any credentials, please try again.

group_members.description: A member of the group has three roles (GROUP_ADMIN, GROUP_ASSOCIATE and USER), each of which has a specific feature. With the GROUP ADMIN/GROUP_ASSOCIATE role, you can create or update group members and eventually delete them. But group associations can not remove the GROUP ADMIN role, they only can remove member that has user role in group. Additionally, you can not remove yourself from group. If you are GROUP ADMIN, when you want to propose someone become GROUP_ADMIN, you will has role USER after.
group_members.name: name
